tests package#

tests.atlas_resampling_test module#

class tests.atlas_resampling_test.TestAtlasResampling(methodName='runTest')[source]#

Bases: TestCase

Unit test for the atlas_resampling() function.

This test verifies that a NIfTI image is properly resampled to a specified voxel size, specifically testing the upsampling from 2mm isotropic voxels to 1mm isotropic voxels.

Test steps: - Create a synthetic NIfTI image with known shape and 2mm voxel size. - Save the image to a temporary file. - Use atlas_resampling() to resample the image to 1mm isotropic voxels. - Load the resampled image and verify:

  • The shape is doubled in each dimension (due to halving voxel size).

  • The voxel dimensions are correctly updated to (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).

test_resampled_image_shape()[source]#

Test that a NIfTI image with 2mm voxel spacing is correctly resampled to 1mm spacing.

Specifically: - Input image shape: (5, 5, 5) - Expected output shape: (10, 10, 10) after upsampling - Confirm that voxel size changes from (2.0, 2.0, 2.0) to (1.0, 1.0, 1.0)

tests.classifiers_test module#

class tests.classifiers_test.TestClassifiers(methodName='runTest')[source]#

Bases: TestCase

Unit tests for classification pipelines defined in classifiers_unified.

The tests validate: - That each model (Random Forest with/without PCA, with RFECV, and SVM with different kernels)

runs end-to-end without exceptions.

  • That each model can predict and returns an output of the correct length.

setUp()[source]#

Create a synthetic dataset for testing.

This method runs before every test case. It generates: - A 30x5 DataFrame with normally distributed features - A corresponding binary label Series with 15 “Normal” and 15 “AD” samples

test_RFPipeline_PCA_runs()[source]#

Test Random Forest pipeline with PCA dimensionality reduction.

Verifies successful model training and prediction.

test_RFPipeline_RFECV_runs()[source]#

Test Random Forest pipeline with recursive feature elimination (RFECV).

Verifies that the model trains and attempts to predict. Since feature elimination can sometimes cause failures (e.g., if too few features are selected), this test is wrapped in a try/except block.

test_RFPipeline_noPCA_runs()[source]#

Test Random Forest pipeline without PCA.

Ensures the model runs without error, supports .predict, and returns predictions of expected length.

test_SVM_simple_linear_runs()[source]#

Test SVM with linear kernel.

Ensures the model is created, supports prediction, and the output is correct.

test_SVM_simple_rbf_runs()[source]#

Test SVM with radial basis function (RBF) kernel.

Ensures proper model training and prediction behavior.

tests.feature_extractor_mocked_test module#

class tests.feature_extractor_mocked_test.TestFeatureExtractorMocked(methodName='runTest')[source]#

Bases: TestCase

Unit test for the feature_extractor() function using mocking and loguru logging.

classmethod setUpClass()[source]#

Create mock data and patch the target function before any test runs.

classmethod tearDownClass()[source]#

Clean up by stopping the patcher.

test_column_names()[source]#

Ensure column names match across all DataFrames.

test_mock_was_called()[source]#

Ensure mock was triggered exactly once.

test_not_empty()[source]#

Ensure DataFrames are not empty.

test_shape_consistency()[source]#

Ensure returned DataFrames have consistent shape.

tests.performance_scores_test module#

class tests.performance_scores_test.TestComputeBinomialError(methodName='runTest')[source]#

Bases: TestCase

Unit tests for the compute_binomial_error function. These tests cover the core statistical behavior of the confidence interval estimation.

test_error_full_probability()[source]#

Test the error for p=1.0. Again, the error should be zero for a perfect classifier.

test_error_invalid_n_samples()[source]#

Test that passing n=0 (invalid number of samples) raises a ZeroDivisionError.

test_error_mid_value()[source]#

Test the error for p=0.5 and n=100. This represents the maximum uncertainty scenario.

test_error_zero_probability()[source]#

Test the error for a perfect classifier (p=0.0). The error bound should be zero.

class tests.performance_scores_test.TestEvaluateModelPerformance(methodName='runTest')[source]#

Bases: TestCase

Unit tests for the evaluate_model_performance function. These tests validate the correctness of metrics, confidence intervals, and input flexibility (e.g., accepting both 1D and 2D probability arrays).

setUp()[source]#

Create dummy prediction labels and probabilities for classification performance testing.

test_auc_close_to_sklearn()[source]#

Ensure the computed AUC matches scikit-learn’s AUC within acceptable tolerance.

test_metric_values_range()[source]#

Check that all metric values (excluding errors) fall between 0.0 and 1.0.

test_output_keys()[source]#

Ensure all expected metric and error keys are present in the output.

test_y_proba_2d_input()[source]#

Ensure that the function correctly handles 2D probability arrays (e.g., from softmax).
